I am a Policy & Data Analyst, freelance consultant, and  enthusiast.
I am an economist with extensive experience (in Italy üáÆüáπ and in the US üá∫üá∏) in empirical research projects within the fields of economic development and impact evaluation of public economic policies. My research focus is at the intersection of public policy and statistics.  You can learn more about my background and publications via the research page, my CV, or the links below. 
As a freelance consultant, I currently support institutional clients, academic researchers and individual professionals in their statistics and data analysis endeavors. I bring an analytical foundation to projects, and help making data-driven decision regardless of the sector or size of the organization. I also love teaching and I have successfully delivered lectures and workshops on statistics, data analysis and visualization.
Here are some illustrative projects.
Feel free to reach out to explore potential collaboration with any statistics, data analysis, or R endeavors.

Introductory workshop on ‚ÄúR for Biostatistics‚Äù (July 2024)

This website collects the materials for a four day workshop organized by MITGEST Doctoral Network in July 2024. The workshop is offered as part of a summer school for EU doctoral biology students, hosted by the Radboud Center for Mitochondrial Medicine, in Nijmegen, Netherlands. My sister (M. Chiara Mimmi, Ph.D.), is in charge of the workshop, while I co-created the materials for the R practice sessions, plus the course website.



Position paper on city government ‚ÄúIdee per Pavia‚Äù (April 2024)
Project website | Code | (in Italian üáÆüáπ)
This is webpage I created to disseminate a position paper that I co-authored with the members of the Catholic Social Action Office of the Diocese of Pavia (my hometown in Italy). The report is meant as a tool to promote open and constructive dialogue on several urban planning issues and proposals in view of the upcoming municipal elections of June 2024.

Exploratory study on text analytics with R ‚ÄúHow slogans end up moving billions‚Äù (2022 - ‚Ä¶)
(WORK IN PROGRESS‚Ä¶)
Project website | Code
This is an ongoing project I started to explore text analytics to answer a question that I find extremely interesting and compelling: What is the impact of slogans on policy decisions? My working hypothesis is that often slogans involves a progressive detachment of words/phrases from their original meaning, so ‚ÄúWhy‚Äù and ‚Äúhow‚Äù does such a deviation between words and reality occur?

title: Miscellaneous Projects
text:
2022

Exploratory Analysis of EU funds (ERDF, 2014-2020 cycle) spending (November 2022)
Project website | Code
This is a quick exploration of some EU structural funds aimed at verifying how much Italy has been able to disburse (given amounts planned and deemed eligible) for the 2014-2020 funding cycle. Specifically data were taken from the ESIF 2014-2020 Finance Implementation Details (99js-gm52) dataset, then drilled down to programs under the ERDF (European Regional Development Fund). This was also an opportunity to learn some interective datavisualization tools in R (e.g.¬†reactable).
